meanings.definition: To make a flame or light flicker or waver.
meanings.sent1: The candle dindled in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The campfire dindled as the logs burned down.
meanings.sent3: The flickering flame dindled like a dancing fairy.
meanings.sent4: Her hope dindled like a fading ember in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dindled light cast eerie shadows on the wall.

meanings.sent1: He dindled away the afternoon watching clouds.
meanings.sent2: She often dindled at her desk instead of working.
meanings.sent3: The cat dindled lazily in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: Time dindled by as they chatted aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: Don't dindle your time; go out and explore!

meanings.definition: To move unsteadily or with a trembling motion.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge dindled under their weight.
meanings.sent2: The jelly dindled on the plate as she carried it.
meanings.sent3: His voice dindled with nervousness during the speech.
meanings.sent4: The boat dindled on the choppy waves of the lake.
meanings.sent5: Her legs dindled as she stood on the shaky platform.
